items.title: Putin's 'worst-case scenario' could be realised in Iran regime change
items.description: Tehran is the epicentre of the nightly protests shaking Iran's regime, but the reverberations are being felt loud and clear in Moscow, too.

items.title: Liberal election autopsy delayed after Dutton suggests report defamatory
items.description: The report, co-authored by Liberal grandees Pru Goward and Nick Minchin, has now been sent to a legal team to ensure it is watertight while the party decides what step to take next.

items.title: Status of hate laws remains uncertain as politicians converge on Canberra
items.description: A special sitting to respond to the Bondi terror attack will begin in Canberra on Monday, but the government is no closer to landing changes to hate laws.

items.title: Trump vows tariffs on eight European countries over Greenland stand-off
items.description: Donald Trump announces the escalating tariffs for Denmark, Norway, Sweden, France, Germany, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and Finland as a row over Greenland continues.

items.title: 'Extremely wild weather': NSW coast battles heavy rainfall, flash flooding
items.description: The State Emergency Service responds to more than 2,300 incidents and 25 flood rescues, most of which involve people driving through floodwaters.

items.title: Live: Aussie Schoolkate knocked out by hobbling Aus Open opponent
items.description: Australian Tristan Schoolkate is unable to avoid a straight-sets loss as 32nd seed Corentin Moutet battles back despite injury on day one of the Australian Open. Follow live.

items.title: Four-year-old boy dies after car crashes into Canberra shopping centre
items.description: The accident happened at Mawson shopping centre in Canberra's south.

items.title: World's first legally binding treaty to protect oceans takes effect
items.description: The High Seas Treaty will govern about two-thirds of the planet's oceans including vast areas beyond any country's borders.

items.title: On the world's largest hospital ship volunteers give people a chance at a better life
items.description: On the largest civilian hospital ship in the world, Australian volunteers provide life-changing healthcare that is transforming lives.

items.title: Israel objects to US announcement of leaders in Gaza peace plan
items.description: The committee announced by the White House includes no Israeli officials but has an Israeli businessperson, billionaire Yakir Gabay.

items.title: US kills 'terrorist' operative linked to deadly IS ambush of three Americans in Syria
items.description: CENTCOM says it conducted a strike in north-west Syria that resulted in the death of an Al Qaeda operative linked to the ISIS gunman responsible for killing two US soldiers and a US civilian in Syria on December 13.

items.title: Large fire in suburban Adelaide sending up huge smoke plume
items.description: Emergency services are responding to a large fire at Croydon Park in Adelaide's north-west that is sending up a huge plume of smoke above surrounding suburbs.

items.title: None in family history, yet 'cancer still found us in the worst way'
items.description: Abbey was "joy on two legs" and now she is gone, another lost to brain cancer. Somehow her family must carry on, as the fight continues for more funding to bring this horror disease to an end.

items.title: Australian fans pay hundreds of dollars to meet NBA icon Allen 'The Answer' Iverson
items.description: NBA great Allen Iverson left hundreds of fans star struck at a meet-and-greet event in Perth, none more so than one of the best NBL players of all time.

items.title: Why one last-second injury has turned the NFL playoffs on its head
items.description: As the final four NFL teams prepare to battle it out for a place in the Super Bowl, a last-minute injury to Denver quarterback Bo Nix has thrown the race for the championship into chaos.

items.title: Bushfires' devastating toll on animal life beginning to emerge
items.description: From animal shelters to "entire generations" of bat colonies, heartbreaking stories of the significant loss of animal life are beginning to emerge in the wake of Victoria's disastrous bushfires and severe heat.

items.title: Pasa Faho to screen at Sydney Opera House after creating a bit of buzz
items.description: Pasa Faho is the story of a shoe salesman who struggles to save his small business and pass on his values to his son.

items.title: Fractured bones, warnings ignored: Files reveal childcare staffing failures
items.description: Staffing and supervision gaps at Canberra childcare centres have resulted in children sustaining broken bones and dislocated jaws, regulator files have revealed, prompting the ACT government to promise change.

items.title: BHP gains ground as CBA loses market share in battle of corporates
items.description: The year is barely underway but already there's a power struggle between our biggest corporations as they fight it out for line honours.

items.title: Man charged over pipe bombs found in Canberra
items.description: The 41-year-old Belconnen man is charged in relation to the 15 pipe bombs found along the shore of Canberra's Lake Ginninderra this week.

items.title: 'Illicit tobacco tzar' appointed to lead team in black market crackdown
items.description: A taskforce will be assembled to combat Western Australia's illicit tobacco market, with plans to pull retired and current police officers into the Department of Health.

items.title: The CIA orchestrated an Iranian coup seven decades ago. It still haunts the US
items.description: Protesters are urging US President Donald Trump to help dismantle Iran's theocracy. If he answers the call, it won't be the first time the US has toppled an Iranian government.

items.title: Return of the flying fish lures tourists to seafood capital
items.description: Port Lincoln's world-famous Tunarama Festival has returned to the South Australian event calendar, with thousands of people lining the streets to celebrate the seafood industry.

items.title: Tourists triple the population of this coastal town, and some never leave
items.description: Former professional surfers and board makers have chosen this small coastal paradise as their home, but with smaller waves, what makes it so special?

items.title: Government dumps plans for Kimberley short stay accommodation
items.description: Leaders in Kununurra say the Cook Government's decision to dump plans for Aboriginal short stay accommodation in town could be putting more people at risk.
